alert.note: Alert for Eastern Box Elder County; Northern Wasatch Front; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 3:28PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Weber... eastern Box Elder...northern Davis and west central Morgan Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 327 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Syracuse, or 8 miles southwest of Hill Air Force Base, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Layton, Hill Air Force Base, Roy, Clearfield, Kaysville, Syracuse, Clinton, North Ogden, South Ogden, Washington Terrace, Riverdale, Hooper, South Weber, Willard, Marriott-Slaterville, Uintah, Weber State University, South Willard and Great Salt Lake South of the Causeway. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 329 and 357. Interstate 84 between mile markers 82 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near the Great Salt Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. A severe thunderstorm watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northern Utah.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Box Elder County; Northern Wasatch Front; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North
